dRTC = rich, uninterrupted gameplay

The gaming industry  is set to hit $244B+ in 2024. Beyond fun, it's a serious biz for streamers & pro gamers.

Imagine you're in a heated battle royale. Your teammate spots an enemy, but their warning comes a second too late. Game over. This is why real-time communication isn't
The future of gaming isn't just about better graphics—it's about creating a truly immersive experience where every command and every interaction happens in real time.

Want to dive deeper into how dRTC can revolutionize your gaming experience?

Check out our latest blog for a comprehensive analysis of the future of gaming and real-time communication ↓

Hyperorganic Systems Design and how Huddle01 is leveraging it for a robust & scalable dRTC Network?

Hyperorganic Protocols are based on the values of the hyperorganic policies which predictably preserve the function of your system. Simple rigid models can give unpredictable

Huddle01 economy dynamically evolves in response to the market conditions, ensuring the token value is always representative of network utility.

Thus, it is transparent to see how the system is performing at all times.

Adaptive protocols and Hyperorganic systems prevent the products from functional breakdowns and save the outcomes from being out of control.

Curious about Hyperorganic Protocols and their impact on adaptive systems? Watch 
@ShrutiAppiah
's talk about the Hyperorganic Systems

The tokens are minted in proportion to the rewards earned by all contributors. Thus, when nodes contribute to network value by supplying bandwidth, we mint tokens to reward the nodes.

Conversely, when protocol generates revenue as users consume bandwidth, tokens are burned in

Media Nodes: The Atomic Unit of Huddle01's dRTC Network

Media Nodes are the backbone of Huddle01's dRTC network. Managing data streams, encoding, decoding, mixing, and routing audio/video packets - all without the dependency on centralized data centers. 

This ensures

Media Node licenses will be distributed fairly via smart contracts, ensuring no single address dominates.
This democratizes participation and strengthens the network.

Join us in democratizing real-time communication.

 Read our latest blog to know more about Huddle01 Media Nodes ↓

Huddle01 Media Node Requirements, no expensive setup needed:

- 4 GB RAM 
- 4 CPU cores 
- 32 GB Disk Space 
- 50 Mbps internet connection

Rewards will be based on bandwidth provided and uptime, with daily snapshots to determine earnings.

dRTC this. dRTC that. 
But what is dRTC a.k.a. decentralized real-time communication and why do we need it? 

RTC, or Real-Time Communication, is a set of technologies that enable real-time, instantaneous exchange of audio, video, and data between devices over the internet.
will be speaking on how to architect and scale decentralised low latency infra , how it can also add value to gaming

"Hyper-organic Protocols predictably preserve the function & utility of your network for the long term. They are dynamically adaptive to the changing conditions so that they can stay perpetually relevant - thus also self governing, and no human intervention required for change"

Interested to read more?
Check out the Huddle01 dRTC Litepaper ↓
…https://bafybeid4ce7apmmdxlxe3pvhqq7qavyioh26banbyskzp3cbpn7asuk2cq.ipfs.w3s.link/Huddle01's%20dRTC%20Litepaper.pdf…

Hyper-organic systems are designed to self-update themselves based on new information coming in. 

Not just functions and parameters, but even monetary policies change with respect to the current state - helping the protocol evolve with time and avoid the risk of systemic

With a hyper-organic design, the economic system is able to morph itself on the basis of demand and supply of the DePIN Network. 

This preserves network utility as a function of the token, and the tokens grow in supply with more value being inputted into the system.
